name: Trent Bascom
descriptions: Trent Bascom is a farmer living at the NCR sharecropper farms in 2281. He can be found tending crops towards the southwestern corner of the farm.

Found working on his crops in the southwestern part of the farms, Trent is one of the critics of the NCR's approach to farmers at the sharecropper farms. Originally making a living in the Hub, Trent moved to the Mojave after the Thaler Act was enacted.

topics.response_text: {NCR - Shunned}Hey, I'm just a farmer. I don't want any trouble and I don't have anything valuable.
Sure do. Came from The Hub on account of the Thaler Act. Farming's decent work, but the whole thing's a bum deal.
Something the politicians back in Shady Sands came up with. They pay us to move here and farm the land. They even protect the fields.

topics.topic_text: Why is this work a bum deal?
topics.response_text: Bad soil and rationed water. It's to be expected around here, but the rationing's off. Worst part is NCR won't admit it.

topics.topic_text: What are NCR troopers doing here?
topics.response_text: They're part of the deal, the Thaler Act. We work the fields while they protect the crops and the water.

topics.topic_text: What kind of crops do you grow?
topics.response_text: Everything I can. Farmers out here don't have the luxury of being picky. I get by mostly on maize and tobacco.

topics.topic_text: Water was being diverted to Westside, but I took care of the problem.
topics.response_text: Westside, huh? I hope the NCR does something about those thieving bastards. I appreciate it, and so do the rest of the farmers.

topics.topic_text: <Lie> The NCR admitted there's bad pipes somewhere, and took care of the problem.
topics.response_text: That's what I figured. Don't know why the heck they're so stubborn they couldn't just admit it.

topics.topic_text: Me? I have no idea what you're talking about.
topics.response_text: Sure you don't. All just a happy coincidence, am I right?

topics.topic_text: What are you going to do now?
topics.response_text: I hear the Brahmin ranchers out in Redding are looking for some hard workers, so I might try there first. I hate working with Brahmin, though.
Good luck to you out here.

topics.topic_text: Can't you just grow less crops?
topics.response_text: I wouldn't be able to meet the quota, and the NCR would kick me out of my job, anyway. Nah, it's better I get out on my own terms.

topics.topic_text: I'm looking for Corporal White. I was told that he'd spoken to you.
topics.response_text: Yes, he said he was looking into the water shortage, but I haven't heard back from him. Got the feeling he wasn't here in any official way.
